title: Flower Fancy font??
content:
Hey everyone, I was hoping I could get advice with a typeface that I seen in a book but I don’t have an example,

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117202543im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Flourish_3865.jpg)

This is the best substitute I could find from dafont! But isn’t great, I was hoping for some suggestions of something similar,

Thanks, Rob

 [‹ Hechter Studio font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117202543/http:/typophile.com/node/40973 "Go to previous forum topic") [ITALIC and SMALL CAP ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117202543/http:/typophile.com/node/40967 "Go to next forum topic")
author: robbiefa

comments.content:
[Lettres ombrées ornées](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117202543/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/l/lettres.htm) were mentioned in [a recent ID request](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117202543/http:/typophile.com/node/40969).  
 [Jester’s Fair Faces](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117202543/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/jfs/fairface.html) are also ‘very embellished’, but I wouldn’t call them similar.  
And have a look at this thread about [extravagantly decorated display faces](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117202543/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39605).  
F
Thanks Florian, It was Lettres ombrées ornées that made me think of this!
